content.description: In many literary works, relationships between siblings (brothers or sisters) create, clarify, or complicate central themes of the work. Either from your own reading or from the list, choose a work of fiction in which a sibling relationship—positive or negative—functions to deepen a central theme. Then, in a well-written essay, analyze how the sibling relationship contributes to an interpretation of the work as a whole. In your response you should do the following: Respond to the prompt with a thesis that presents a defensible interpretation. Provide evidence to support your line of reasoning. Explain how the evidence supports your line of reasoning. Use appropriate grammar and punctuation in communicating your argument. Absalom, Absalom!
